column2: Bel 1:5 Who answered and said, Because I may not worship idols made with hands, but the living God, who hath created the heaven and the earth, and hath sovereignty over all flesh.
column3: Bel one to five Who answered and said, Because I may not worship idols made with hands, but the living God, who hath created the heaven and the earth, and hath sovereignty over all flesh.

column2: Bel 1:6 Then said the king unto him, Thinkest thou not that Bel is a living God? seest thou not how much he eateth and drinketh every day?
column3: Bel one to six Then said the king unto him, Thinkest thou not that Bel is a living God? seest thou not how much he eateth and drinketh every day?

column2: Bel 1:7 Then Daniel smiled, and said, O king, be not deceived: for this is but clay within, and brass without, and did never eat or drink any thing.
column3: Bel one to seven Then Daniel smiled, and said, O king, be not deceived: for this is but clay within, and brass without, and did never eat or drink any thing.

column2: Bel 1:8 So the king was wroth, and called for his priests, and said unto them, If ye tell me not who this is that devoureth these expences, ye shall die.
column3: Bel one to eight So the king was wroth, and called for his priests, and said unto them, If ye tell me not who this is that devoureth these expences, ye shall die.

column2: Bel 1:9 But if ye can certify me that Bel devoureth them, then Daniel shall die: for he hath spoken blasphemy against Bel.
column3: Bel one to nine But if ye can certify me that Bel devoureth them, then Daniel shall die: for he hath spoken blasphemy against Bel.

column2: And Daniel said unto the king, Let it be according to thy word.
column3: And Daniel said unto the king, Let it be according to thy word.

column2: Bel 1:10 Now the priests of Bel were threescore and ten, beside their wives and children.
column3: Bel one ten Now the priests of Bel were threescore and ten, beside their wives and children.

column2: And the king went with Daniel into the temple of Bel.
column3: And the king went with Daniel into the temple of Bel.

column2: Bel 1:11 So Bel's priests said, Lo, we go out: but thou, O king, set on the meat, and make ready the wine, and shut the door fast and seal it with thine own signet;
column3: Bel one eleven So Bel's priests said, Lo, we go out: but thou, O king, set on the meat, and make ready the wine, and shut the door fast and seal it with thine own signet;

column2: Bel 1:12 And to morrow when thou comest in, if thou findest not that Bel hath eaten up all, we will suffer death: or else Daniel, that speaketh falsely against us.
column3: Bel one twelve And to morrow when thou comest in, if thou findest not that Bel hath eaten up all, we will suffer death: or else Daniel, that speaketh falsely against us.

column2: Bel 1:13 And they little regarded it: for under the table they had made a privy entrance, whereby they entered in continually, and consumed those things.
column3: Bel one thirteen And they little regarded it: for under the table they had made a privy entrance, whereby they entered in continually, and consumed those things.

column2: Bel 1:14 So when they were gone forth, the king set meats before Bel.
column3: Bel one fourteen So when they were gone forth, the king set meats before Bel.

column2: Now Daniel had commanded his servants to bring ashes, and those they strewed throughout all the temple in the presence of the king alone: then went they out, and shut the door, and sealed it with the king's signet, and so departed.
column3: Now Daniel had commanded his servants to bring ashes, and those they strewed throughout all the temple in the presence of the king alone: then went they out, and shut the door, and sealed it with the king's signet, and so departed.

column2: Bel 1:15 Now in the night came the priests with their wives and children, as they were wont to do, and did eat and drinck up all.
column3: Bel one fifteen Now in the night came the priests with their wives and children, as they were wont to do, and did eat and drinck up all.

column2: Bel 1:16 In the morning betime the king arose, and Daniel with him.
column3: Bel one sixteen In the morning betime the king arose, and Daniel with him.

column2: Bel 1:17 And the king said, Daniel, are the seals whole?
column3: Bel one seventeen And the king said, Daniel, are the seals whole?

column2: And he said, Yea, O king, they be whole.
column3: And he said, Yea, O king, they be whole.

column2: Bel 1:18 And as soon as he had opened the dour, the king looked upon the table, and cried with a loud voice, Great art thou, O Bel, and with thee is no deceit at all.
column3: Bel one eighteen And as soon as he had opened the dour, the king looked upon the table, and cried with a loud voice, Great art thou, O Bel, and with thee is no deceit at all.

column2: Bel 1:19 Then laughed Daniel, and held the king that he should not go in, and said, Behold now the pavement, and mark well whose footsteps are these.
column3: Bel one nineteen Then laughed Daniel, and held the king that he should not go in, and said, Behold now the pavement, and mark well whose footsteps are these.

column2: Bel 1:20 And the king said, I see the footsteps of men, women, and children.
column3: Bel one twenty And the king said, I see the footsteps of men, women, and children.

column2: And then the king was angry,
column3: And then the king was angry,

column2: Bel 1:21 And took the priests with their wives and children, who shewed him the privy doors, where they came in, and consumed such things as were upon the table.
column3: Bel one twenty one And took the priests with their wives and children, who shewed him the privy doors, where they came in, and consumed such things as were upon the table.

column2: Bel 1:22 Therefore the king slew them, and delivered Bel into Daniel's power, who destroyed him and his temple.
column3: Bel one twenty two Therefore the king slew them, and delivered Bel into Daniel's power, who destroyed him and his temple.

column2: Bel 1:23 And in that same place there was a great dragon, which they of Babylon worshipped.
column3: Bel one twenty three And in that same place there was a great dragon, which they of Babylon worshipped.

column2: Bel 1:24 And the king said unto Daniel, Wilt thou also say that this is of brass?
column3: Bel one twenty four And the king said unto Daniel, Wilt thou also say that this is of brass?

column2: lo, he liveth, he eateth and drinketh; thou canst not say that he is no living god: therefore worship him.
column3: lo, he liveth, he eateth and drinketh; thou canst not say that he is no living god: therefore worship him.

column2: Bel 1:25 Then said Daniel unto the king, I will worship the Lord my God: for he is the living God.
column3: Bel one twenty five Then said Daniel unto the king, I will worship the Lord my God: for he is the living God.

column2: Bel 1:26 But give me leave, O king, and I shall slay this dragon without sword or staff.
column3: Bel one twenty six But give me leave, O king, and I shall slay this dragon without sword or staff.

column2: The king said, I give thee leave.
column3: The king said, I give thee leave.

column2: Bel 1:27 Then Daniel took pitch, and fat, and hair, and did seethe them together, and made lumps thereof: this he put in the dragon's mouth, and so the dragon burst in sunder: and Daniel said, Lo, these are the gods ye worship.
column3: Bel one twenty seven Then Daniel took pitch, and fat, and hair, and did seethe them together, and made lumps thereof: this he put in the dragon's mouth, and so the dragon burst in sunder: and Daniel said, Lo, these are the gods ye worship.

column2: Bel 1:28 When they of Babylon heard that, they took great indignation, and conspired against the king, saying, The king is become a Jew, and he hath destroyed Bel, he hath slain the dragon, and put the priests to death.
column3: Bel one twenty eight When they of Babylon heard that, they took great indignation, and conspired against the king, saying, The king is become a Jew, and he hath destroyed Bel, he hath slain the dragon, and put the priests to death.

column2: Bel 1:29 So they came to the king, and said, Deliver us Daniel, or else we will destroy thee and thine house.
column3: Bel one twenty nine So they came to the king, and said, Deliver us Daniel, or else we will destroy thee and thine house.

column2: Bel 1:30 Now when the king saw that they pressed him sore, being constrained, he delivered Daniel unto them:
column3: Bel one thirty Now when the king saw that they pressed him sore, being constrained, he delivered Daniel unto them:

column2: Bel 1:31 Who cast him into the lions' den: where he was six days.
column3: Bel one thirty one Who cast him into the lions' den: where he was six days.

column2: Bel 1:32 And in the den there were seven lions, and they had given them every day two carcases, and two sheep: which then were not given to them, to the intent they might devour Daniel.
column3: Bel one thirty two And in the den there were seven lions, and they had given them every day two carcases, and two sheep: which then were not given to them, to the intent they might devour Daniel.

column2: Bel 1:33 Now there was in Jewry a prophet, called Habbacuc, who had made pottage, and had broken bread in a bowl, and was going into the field, for to bring it to the reapers.
column3: Bel one thirty three Now there was in Jewry a prophet, called Habbacuc, who had made pottage, and had broken bread in a bowl, and was going into the field, for to bring it to the reapers.

column2: Bel 1:34 But the angel of the Lord said unto Habbacuc, Go, carry the dinner that thou hast into Babylon unto Daniel, who is in the lions' den.
column3: Bel one thirty four But the angel of the Lord said unto Habbacuc, Go, carry the dinner that thou hast into Babylon unto Daniel, who is in the lions' den.

column2: Bel 1:35 And Habbacuc said, Lord, I never saw Babylon; neither do I know where the den is.
column3: Bel one thirty five And Habbacuc said, Lord, I never saw Babylon; neither do I know where the den is.

column2: Bel 1:36 Then the angel of the Lord took him by the crown, and bare him by the hair of his head, and through the vehemency of his spirit set him in Babylon over the den.
column3: Bel one thirty six Then the angel of the Lord took him by the crown, and bare him by the hair of his head, and through the vehemency of his spirit set him in Babylon over the den.

column2: Bel 1:37 And Habbacuc cried, saying, O Daniel, Daniel, take the dinner which God hath sent thee.
column3: Bel one thirty seven And Habbacuc cried, saying, O Daniel, Daniel, take the dinner which God hath sent thee.

column2: Bel 1:38 And Daniel said, Thou hast remembered me, O God: neither hast thou forsaken them that seek thee and love thee.
column3: Bel one thirty eight And Daniel said, Thou hast remembered me, O God: neither hast thou forsaken them that seek thee and love thee.

column2: Bel 1:39 So Daniel arose, and did eat: and the angel of the Lord set Habbacuc in his own place again immediately.
column3: Bel one thirty nine So Daniel arose, and did eat: and the angel of the Lord set Habbacuc in his own place again immediately.

column2: Bel 1:40 Upon the seventh day the king went to bewail Daniel: and when he came to the den, he looked in, and behold, Daniel was sitting.
column3: Bel one forty Upon the seventh day the king went to bewail Daniel: and when he came to the den, he looked in, and behold, Daniel was sitting.

column2: Bel 1:41 Then cried the king with a loud voice, saying, Great art Lord God of Daniel, and there is none other beside thee.
column3: Bel one forty one Then cried the king with a loud voice, saying, Great art Lord God of Daniel, and there is none other beside thee.

column2: Bel 1:42 And he drew him out, and cast those that were the cause of his destruction into the den: and they were devoured in a moment before his face.
column3: Bel one forty two And he drew him out, and cast those that were the cause of his destruction into the den: and they were devoured in a moment before his face.
